utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Happy birthday!!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Happy birthday!!!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Rach! Come on! Rach!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s your birthday!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: She’s not as pretty as she was when she was 29.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Ms. Green would like to establish some ground rules before she comes out. She would appreciate it if you don’t use the words old or downhill or they still look pretty damn good.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: They do!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Rachel! Come on out! Monica made breakfast!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chocolate-chip pancakes!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We’ve got presents!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Good ones?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: They all came from the list you handed out to us two weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, can I keep the presents and still be 29?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on Rach! Look, turning thirty is not that big a deal.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh really. Is that how you felt when you turned thirty?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why God?!! Why?!! We had a deal!! Let the others grow old! Not me!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y’know, I’m still 29 in Guam.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, 30 is not that old! Do you know how old the Earth is?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Late thirties? Oh come on you guys! Is it just me? Am I overreacting to this?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No Rach, it’s not just you. My thirtieth birthday certainly wasn’t that much fun.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And now Chandler! We’re all gettin’ so old! Why are you doing this to us?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Rach, you’re in a great place in your life. Come on, you’ve got a great job! Good friends…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, you’re roommate is a soap opera star.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Look, y’know I know my life’s going pretty well, but I look around and I just see so many people who’ve accomplished so many other goals by the time they’re thirty.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, but you shouldn’t compare yourself to me.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Come on Phoebe! You can do it Phoebe! Come on!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: There you go!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thirty. Ugh, I mean thirty! Monica, do you remember mean, old Mrs. Kreeger in the fifth grade? She was thirty!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Come on, let’s have some fun. Huh? What do you want to do today?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Nothing. I don’t want to do anything.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, doing nothing on your thirtieth is better than doing something stupid, like Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! That was a practical purchase! I needed that car for transportation! Okay? I-I have a child!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: How hot do I look in this, huh?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ross, a sports car? Wouldn’t it have been cheaper to just stuff a sock down there?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s not what this is about okay? I-I am a sports car enthusiast. I have always been into cars.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, what’s the horsepower on this thing?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don’t know, but-but look how shiny!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can’t believe you bought this.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really! God Ross, what were you thinking? I know it’s really shallow, but a part of me wants him again.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, well get in line missy. So, can I have a ride stud?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hop in. Get ready for the smoothest ride of your life.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Damnit!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, who’s next?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y’know what? I am going to do something today. I’m not just gonna sit around like some old lady. I’m gonna get something pierced. Like my uh, like my nose or my tongue or something.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Really?! ‘Cause y’know that hurts.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So what?! Y’know what? The way I see it——Ow! Son of a bitch!!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Look Rachel, I know what you’re going through. I’m totally freaked about turning 25.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Get out, get out of my apartment.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right Rach, for what it’s worth, I think that you’re doing great. I mean y’know let’s face it, no one handles this well.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Least of all you.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Why? What you’d do?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Weren’t you asked to leave sonny?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Would you put that back on?! Monica’s gonna be here any minute!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: But it hurt’s my Joey’s Apple.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, for the last time. It’s not named for each individual man.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: You’ve done a wonderful job with this party Chandler. Everything looks so lovely.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh well, not as lovely as you. I mean, I can’t believe that you would have a thirty-year-old daughter! And you! I can’t believe that you would have a tux that’s thirty years old!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: It’s older than that. Ross was actually conceived right near this tuxedo.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ohh!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey! Everybody hide! Hide! I saw her! She’s coming!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay! Okay! Everybody down! Everybody down!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Crap.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, everybody stay here. I will find out what’s going on.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Heyyy!! You got the door open!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey-hey are you drunk?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nooo! Okay. Whoa! Okay. See I was, I was a little nervous about turning thirty. So the bus boys took me out for some drinks. I wanna puke on you later!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, here is the thing. We have thrown a very formal surprise party for you in there! All of your friends are in there and your parents!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Noo!!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Noo!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh no! My parents have never seen me drunk! That they know of.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, here’s the thing. We’re gonna get you some coffee and they will never know that you’re drunk.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really?! You promise?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ll take care of it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. I love you so much.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay we have to do something about your breath.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What about your breath?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s still yours. Okay, now remember it’s a surprise party. So, when you go in, act surprised.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. I can do that.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Surprise!!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, forward. Forward—Stop! Okay, back—Stop! Okay, forward—Stop! Stop! Stop!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross, just forget about it. This guy’s got you totally wedged in.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Is this yours?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well actually…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No-no-no! It’s mine! It’s-it’s mine.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dude, you soooo need this car.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. Okay, here’s what we’re gonna do. Okay, I’m gonna break into this mini-van and put it in neutral. You guys push it forward so Ross can drive out of his spot. Okay? All right, here we go. Haul ass!!!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Happy thirtieth birthday! Here! It’s for the child in you, and the woman. Happy thirtieth!

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Right, why do you keep saying that?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Because it’s our thirtieth birthday.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Yeah, no we’re not thirty. We’re 31. Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait!

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Oh, it’s you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. What?!

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Yeah, we’re not thirty, we’re 31.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Nu-uh!

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Yea-huh! That’s what is says on my birth certificate.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You have your birth certificate?

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Yeah, I got a big box of family stuff when my mom died.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Our mom.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Right! Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Do you have my birth certificate?

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: No, I sold it to a Swedish runaway.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God! Oh my God, we are 31.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I just lost a whole year of my life.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Your middle name is Pamela?

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I never knew mine. Do you remember what it is?

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Yes! Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s my first name.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Right, okay, then no.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay before we start the celebration, Monica has to go put on her party dress.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yay!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: See? Here we go.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Happy birthday, sweetie! Give us a hug!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Don’t get up Jack! The safety pins are about to blow.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Paul!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Phil.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phil!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Now, there is a dress laid out on your bed. Okay, you’re doing great. You’re doing great. You’re doing fine.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Monica’s a little drunk.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yay! I love drunk Monica!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Awwwww…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Go change! She doesn’t want her parents to know she’s drunk.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh! All right! All right. Here’s what we’ll do, I’ll get twice as drunk as Monica and then no one’s will even notice her.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What’s-what’s going on? Phil’s really pissed!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Monica’s wasted.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Maybe that will liven up this party.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, will you just go help her change please!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, but taking care of a drunk, naked woman seems like a job for Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: This one’s from me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ahh!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: It wasn’t on your list, but hopefully you’ll think it’s really fun.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: A scooter!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Stick to the list. Always stick to the list.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! No-no, I love it. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, open ours next. Open ours next!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Now that you’re a couple, we don’t get two presents from you guys?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: For my last birthday you gave me a hug! Okay, read the card! Read the card!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Happy birthday Grandma! It’s better to be over the hill then buried under it. All our love Monica and Chandler. That’s funny, yeah!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No-no-no-no! That was the joke!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, I know! I get it! It’s funny!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, because you’re not a grandmother!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No I know, because to be a grandmother you have to be married and have children and I don’t have any of those things. That’s why it’s so funny.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All you had to do was buy the card!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! Look who’s back! It’s the birthday girl! How’s the birthday girl feeling?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I feel fine, but I think you’re bumming out the rest of the kids.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay! Y’know what? I realized it was stupid to get upset about not having a husband and kids. All I really needed was a plan. See I wanna have three kids…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh let me guess, and you wanna have them all at the same time and you wanna have them for your brother.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: As I was saying… I should probably have the first of the three kids by the time I’m 35 which gives me five years. I love this plan! I wanna marry this plan!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: If you could do that, I’d marry the hippity-hop.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So, if I wanna have my kid when I’m 35, I don’t have to get pregnant until I’m 34. Which gives Prada four years to start making maternity clothes! Oh wait, but I do want to be married for a year before I get pregnant…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really! That long?! Look all you want, it’s happening!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, so I don’t have to get married until I’m 33! That’s three years, that’s three whole years—Oh, wait a minute though. I’ll need a year and a half to plan the wedding, and I’d like to know the guy for a year, year and a half before we get engaged… Which means I need to meet the guy by the time I’m thirty.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Which is fine! Because you just turned——twenty-eight!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! Ross, no! It is not fine! Eh-eh-according to my plan I should already be with the guy I wanna marry!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Will you quit hoggin’ it!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m telling you it’s like watching Bambi learn how to walk.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You’re drunk! Mom and dad are gonna be maaaaadd! Maybe I’m a little drunk.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh that’s great! Right there! Can we get some of that over here please? There we go.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! Are those crab cakes? Did I not tell ya to come straight to me when more crab cakes were ready?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How are you feeling?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You are so handsome! I wanna make love to you right here, right now!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I really wish that you wouldn’t.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Now all you have to do is just get through a little bit more, okay? Then we can put you in bed, okay? Just smile and don’t talk to anyone.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Speech! Speech! Let’s hear from the birthday girl! Huh?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Pheebs!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Don’t you see? Everyone’s looking at me! The plan’s working! I didn’t even have to take off my top yet!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Speech! Come on Monica!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Come on! Speech!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Hey Chandler, you can’t keep your hands off her for one second!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Oh-ho, I think it’s nice.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I think it’s necessary.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I-I-I wanna thank you all for coming. My family and my friends…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wooo!! Hoo!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I really like to say that I’m-um… Y’know what I’d really like to say? I’m drunk!! That’s right mom and dad your little Harmonica is hammered!! And guess what! I’ve been drunk before! And I’ve smoked a cigarette! And I got a box of Ding-Dongs hidden in my underwear drawer! It’s all okay. It’s okay because I turned thirty today. And, and I can do anything I want! Because I am a grown up.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay quick, help me get this off!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I lost a whole year! I can’t believe it! This is so unfair!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know Pheebs. It’ll be okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Will it? Will it?! I mean, how would you feel if you found out you were 31?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s not gonna happen. No. Because we have a new deal!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Plus, it totally ruined my schedule! I…I haven’t done any of the things I wanted to do by the time I was 31!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Like okay I-I-I, I haven’t met any Portuguese people! I, I haven’t had the perfect kiss! And I haven’t been to sniper’s school!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe, y’know why don’t we just go upstairs and have some birthday cake?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, I just feel like being by myself for a while. All right? I’ll see you guys later. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey. Oh, poor Pheebs.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, y’know what you guys? I think I’m gonna go walk her home.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh man!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: He’s gonna eat the cake!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Pheebs! Wait up! Listen uh, close your eyes. Maybe that’s one thing you can cross off your list.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, and plus I’m 1/16th Portuguese.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, is everybody clear? We’re gonna pick it up…and move it. Now all we need is teamwork, okay? We’re gonna lift the car…and slide it out. Lift and slide!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, I really don’t think…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Lift!! And slide!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, here we go.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right everyone, lift! And slide!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey Joey, can I…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, come on Rach! My turn just started!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Actually, I just wanna talk to Tag.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh. Okay. Hey, can I ride this outside?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Whatever! Okay, I’m not your mother.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Not in the street!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: How are you doing? Are you feeling any better?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m doing okay. I’m um…let’s talk.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Umm…

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh Tag, umm…you’re such a great guy and we have sooo much fun together but I don’t-I don’t…

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Wait! I think I see where you’re going, but before you say anything else, can I just say one more thing?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well said. And a uh good example of the fun I was referring to uhh, but I just think I’m past the point where I think I can y’know, just have fun.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Rachel, don’t do this. This is just because you’re turning thirty.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, it is! But you’re just a kid! I mean you’re 25!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Twenty-four actually.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh God! Y’know what I wish? I wish you were six years older. Well actually, if I’m wishin’ for stuff, I actually wish I was six years younger.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey! How’d it go?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, if I only want two kids, can I keep him for another year?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You did the right thing.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t like this anymore.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, here we are, just a bunch of thirty year olds.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: God, do you realize in ten years we’re gonna be 40?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why God?! Why are you doing this to us?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes! My baby’s finally free!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All-all right! Start it up! Let’s go!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Woohoo!

utterance.speaker: The Man In The Sportscar
utterance.content: How hot are we?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You wanna buy a car?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No.
